title: Shillong varsity professor, vendor held by CBI on graft charges
content: “During the investigation, CBI sleuths raided premises linked to the accused at two places and recovered incriminating documents,” the statement said

title: Kerala shipwreck: State to file admiralty suit in High Court
content: AG’s advice sought on action to be taken to ‘arrest’ any vessel of Elsa 3 Maritime Inc., MCM SA, or MSC Geneva within Kerala’s waters

title: Congress move for fresh caste census is to make up for image lost in Bengaluru stampede deaths, says Union Minister Shobha Karandlaje
content: Union Minister claims that the decision is also aimed at dividing the castes further by breaking them at a deeper level

title: Air India plane crash: Flight services to Ahmedabad from Kerala suspended until further notice
content: An aircraft that earlier left for Ahmedabad from Kochi airport is returning. Passengers advised to check with airlines for updates

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Flight operations at Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel airport temporarily suspended
content: There were 232 passengers and 10 crew members on board the Air India plane that crashed in a residential area near Ahmedabad airport

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder: State Government felicitates tourist guide, 35 others for assisting police in probe
content: Meghalaya Minister Paul Lyngdoh distributed cash rewards of ₹5.4 lakh to travel guide Albert Pde and 35 others

title: Kerala shipwreck: Centre gives 48-hour ultimatum to ship owner MSC to extract oil from sunken vessel
content: Director General of Shipping says ‘consistent inaction and delay by owners and salvors appointed by the firm represent not only negligence but also a violation of statutory obligations’

title: Air India plane crashed just 5 minutes after takeoff from Ahmedabad; pilot gave mayday call
content: The Boeing 787 aircraft took off from the airport at 1:39 p.m. with 232 passengers, including 2 infants and 10 crew members

title: Bengaluru stampede: Karnataka High Court orders release of RCB’s Nikhil Sosale and others
content: It was argued on behalf of the petitioners that they were arrested based solely on “the CM’s orders” without conducting any investigation and collecting any material to point out that the petitioners were responsible for the stampede.

title: Kurnool district police handover 604 lost or stolen mobile phones to owners
content: The mobile phones were recovered from various districts of Andhra Pradesh and also from Delhi, Bengaluru and Hyderabad

title: Modi govt democratised use of technology in 11-year rule: Amit Shah
content: The Home Minister said whether it is healthcare, education, trade, or commerce, PM Modi has transformed every sector of the economy and society through the digital revolution

title: Students in A.P. back to school with new goals, new excitement
content: The school corridors echoed with laughter eve as teachers warmly welcomed students back to a fresh start following the summer vacation.

title: Attempts to resolve standoff with Anbumani ended in ‘draw’: PMK founder Ramadoss
content: Mr. Ramadoss said he would not take the step of expelling his son Mr. Anbumani from the primary membership of the party

title: New Tatkal ticket booking rules: How to link Aadhaar to your IRCTC account
content: The new provisions include Aadhaar-based authentication as a prerequisite for online Tatkal bookings.

title: Kerala Civil Police Officer arrested for planting hidden camera in women police changing room
content: Vyshak discreetly installed spy camera near women’s changing area of Vandiperiyar police station in Idukki and recorded visuals. He later sent visuals to one of the women officers who then filed a complaint with Women’s Cell

title: Objectionable photos found in phone of Mathura youth arrested over 'provocative' online post
content: Police said the youth allegedly lured the women into relationships by pretending to be a Hindu, filmed them in compromising situations and circulated online

title: T.N. CM Stalin releases water from Mettur Dam for delta irrigation
content: In the 92-year history of the Mettur Dam, this marks the 20th time that water has been released for delta irrigation on its customary date, June 12

title: India slips to 131st position in Global Gender Gap Index 2025
content: With a parity score of just 64.1%, India is among the lowest-ranked countries in South Asia, according to the report released on June 12, 2025

title: Woman constable dies, 2 other policemen injured after being hit by speeding car in Patna
content: The deceased constable has been identified as Komal (22), while those injured are Deepak Kumar (sub-inspector) and Awdesh Kumar (assistant sub-inspector).

title: Indian-origin physician Bobby Mukkamala sworn in as American Medical Association president
content: Dr. Bobby Mukkamala became the first physician of Indian heritage to lead the American Medical Association

title: Madras High Court suspends IAS officer Anshul Mishra’s one-month sentence in contempt plea
content: A Division Bench of Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan direct the officer to deposit ₹25,000 with the Registrar (Judicial) of the High Court

title: The carving chef: Raju garu’s rise from kitchens to Telugu TV
content: With over 9000 recipes and a love for natural ingredients, chef Raju garu has carved out a niche in the world of televised Telugu cuisine

title: Karnataka rains: Man washed away in overflowing drain in Hubballi
content: Hubballi received heavy rains on June 11 evening, which continued past midnight resulting in waterlogging in many localities

title: Tension in Odisha's Bhadrak after man's death in clash over cattle smuggling; internet suspended
content: Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi has announced a compensation of ₹10 lakh and job for one of the family members of the deceased and ordered strict action against the culprits

title: 12 children from childcare homes in Kerala’s Ernakulam join families under vacation foster care program
content: Inquiry officers conduct home study of potential foster family, prepare a social investigation report, and investigate financial and medical backgrounds before allotting children

title: Jyestabhishekam concludes on a religious note at Tirumala
content: The day commenced with Maha Shanti Homam and was followed by Snapana Thirumanjanam at the Kalyanotsava mandapam inside the temple complex.

title: Addressing non-tariff barriers key for India, EU trade pact, says Piyush Goyal
content: Union Commerce Minister added that both India and the EU are in active discussions to find solutions to make business smooth for companies of both sides.

title: PM Modi lauds India's technological, digital progress in past 11 years
content: ‘Powered by the youth of India, we are making remarkable progress in innovation and application of technology,’ PM Modi said on June 12.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Karnataka Leader of Opposition R. Ashok seeks NHRC intervention
content: The NHRC’s intervention through probe is vital not only to secure justice for the affected families, but also to ensure that such incidents do not recur, says Ashok

title: COVID-19: Isolation beds kept ready in Kalyan-Dombivli civic hospitals in Maharashtra’s Thane
content: Maharashtra reported 107 new COVID-19 cases on June 11, 2025, taking the total of viral infections detected in the State so far this year to 1,700, as per the Public Health Department

title: Ahmedabad horror: Air India flight crashes, erupts in flames; PM Modi speaks to aviation minister
content: An Air India Ahmedabad-London flight crashed shortly after takeoff from Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport in Ahmedabad. The aircraft went down in the Meghani area, sending a dark plume of smoke visible for kilometers. Emergency services have rushed to the scene. As of now, there's no official confirmation on casualties or the cause of the crash.

title: Watch: Moment Air India plane crashed near Ahmedabad airport
content: An Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner, en route from Ahmedabad to London, tragically crashed shortly after takeoff in the Meghani area. Carrying over 240 passengers, the wide-body aircraft's heavy fuel load intensified the post-crash fire, hindering rescue operations. Authorities, including the DGCA and Boeing, have launched investigations, while the central government pledges full support to Gujarat in managing the disaster.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: 'Deeply anguished' - Sports fraternity reacts
content: An Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner, flight AI171, tragically crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad, bound for London Gatwick. The crash into a populated area resulted in a massive fire, with 242 people onboard. Rescue operations are underway as authorities investigate the cause, while the nation mourns the devastating loss and offers support to affected families.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: There’s a new programming language. It is called…
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: Nifty50 goes below 24,900; Sensex sinks 900 points - Top 5 reasons stock market is falling
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Thursday. While Nifty50 went below 24,900, BSE Sensex crashed 900 points.

title: Ahmedabad airport closed for flight operations
content: A major incident occurred in Ahmedabad. An Air India flight AI171, bound for London, crashed after takeoff. The Boeing 787 Dreamliner went down in the Meghaninagar area. Airport operations are suspended. Emergency services responded quickly. Many casualties are feared. Injured passengers are receiving treatment at the city civil hospital. Air India is gathering more information about the incident.

title: Meet Radhika Subramaniam: AI influencer who’s redefining travel content
content: Collective Artists Network introduces Radhika Subramaniam, India's first AI travel influencer, designed to share local stories rooted in culture. Representing a Gen Z solo traveler, Radhika aims to connect with audiences through authentic storytelling. Speaking both Tamil and English, she offers brands a consistent voice for context-rich narratives.

title: 'We are ready': Iran’s veiled warning on reports of Israel preparing strike
content: Amid heightened regional tensions, Israel is reportedly prepared to launch an operation into Iran, prompting US concerns about potential retaliation against American sites in Iraq. The US State Department has advised non-emergency personnel to leave Iraq, while President Trump asserts that Iran cannot possess nuclear weapons.

title: Ahmedabad crash: Air India flight lost signal at 625 feet, within a minute of takeoff
content: An Air India flight AI171 bound for London Gatwick crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad airport on Thursday, impacting a residential area in Meghaninagar. The crash occurred around 2:00 pm, with the aircraft losing signal at a low altitude. Rescue operations are underway, with multiple fire tenders deployed to control the blaze.

title: Why cooling will be limited between 20°C & 28°C; what govt says
content: The Indian government is planning to implement a new rule standardizing air conditioner temperatures between 20°C and 28°C to curb excessive electricity consumption. This initiative aims to manage India's rising energy demand, particularly during peak summer months when AC usage significantly strains the power supply.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: AI pilot gave Mayday call; ATC response went unanswered
content: An Air India B787, flight AI-171, crashed immediately after takeoff from Ahmedabad, en route to Gatwick. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) reported 242 individuals were aboard. The aircraft, commanded by Captain Sumeet Sabharwal, issued a MAYDAY call before losing contact with ATC.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Pilot issued Mayday call before crash; what is it?
content: An Air India flight AI171, en route from Ahmedabad to London Gatwick, tragically crashed shortly after takeoff on June 12, 2025. The pilot, Captain Sumeet Sabharwal, issued a Mayday call before the Boeing 787, carrying 242 individuals, lost contact with air traffic control.

title: Air India Ahmedabad-London Gatwick plane crash; here's what airlines said
content: Air India flight AI171, en route from Ahmedabad to London Gatwick, was involved in a crash shortly after takeoff on June 12, 2025. The Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, carrying 242 individuals, including crew, experienced the incident. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) confirmed the crash and deployed NDRF teams to the Ahmedabad airport crash site.

title: Woman strangled, found in bedsheet-wrapped suitcase in Ghaziabad
content: Ghaziabad police have registered a murder case after a woman's body was discovered in a suitcase along Canal Road. The autopsy revealed the cause of death to be strangulation and suffocation. Authorities believe the woman, approximately 25 years old, was murdered on Monday night, and four teams have been formed to investigate, focusing on CCTV footage and identifying the victim.

title: ‘Villa, flats, 19 plots, 16-acre land, gold, crores in bank’: Telangana engineer held
content: Anti-Corruption Bureau teams raided the residence of Nune Sridhar, a senior irrigation engineer involved in the Kaleshwaram Lift Irrigation Project, unearthing assets worth approximately ₹60 crore disproportionate to his known income sources. Sridhar, who previously supervised the Gayathri pump house, was arrested following searches at 14 locations across multiple cities. The raids occurred amidst an inquiry into alleged KLIP irregularities.

title: Global religious landscape: Muslims and atheists grew fastest; Christians still largest group
content: A recent report analyzing global religious trends reveals Islam as the fastest-growing religion, while Christianity experiences a decline in growth despite remaining the largest. The religiously unaffiliated population also saw an increase, driven by religious switching and a rise in individuals with no religious affiliation. Other major religions like Hinduism and Judaism experienced growth in line with the overall population.

title: Patna hit-and-run: Woman constable dies, 2 other policemen injured
content: In Patna, a tragic incident occurred near Srikrishna Puri. A speeding vehicle crashed into a routine vehicle check. A woman constable, Komal, lost her life. Two other police officers, Deepak Kumar and Awdesh Kumar, sustained injuries. They were checking vehicles on Atal Path. Police arrested two passengers from the responsible car. The injured officers are receiving treatment.

title: Why Mexican flag flew high at Los Angeles protests - explained
content: In Los Angeles, protests against ICE raids saw demonstrators burning self-driving taxis and confronting police, prominently displaying the Mexican flag. This symbol, reminiscent of past protests against anti-immigrant measures like Proposition 187, represents opposition to deportation policies and solidarity with the immigrant community.

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder rerun: UP woman kills husband 18 years after marriage
content: In Siddharthnagar, Sangeeta Devi and her lover, Anil Shukla, were arrested for murdering Sangeeta's husband, Kannan Kumar. Sangeeta poisoned Kannan after a temple visit and, with Anil, threw his body into the Rapti river. She then filed a missing person report, but inconsistencies led to her confession. Kannan's brother had already suspected foul play due to marital issues.

title: Honeymoon horror: How mangalsutra, ring left at homestay helped cops crack case
content: Police solved the murder case of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi. He was killed during his honeymoon in Meghalaya. His wife, Sonam, and her boyfriend are suspects. A mangalsutra and ring left behind were key clues. The body was found near Weisawdong Falls. Sonam surrendered in Ghazipur, Uttar Pradesh. Police arrested her boyfriend and three contract killers.

title: Bangladesh's Yunus asked Modi to stop Hasina from speaking - how PM responded
content: Mohammad Yunus, chief advisor to Bangladesh's interim government, revealed at Chatham House that he requested PM Modi to restrain Sheikh Hasina's communications after she sought refuge in India. Yunus expressed concern over alleged fake news from Indian media fueling unease in Bangladesh.

title: BCCI to discuss norms for IPL victory celebrations after Bengaluru stampede; RCB ban not on cards
content: Following a tragic stampede after RCB's IPL victory celebrations, the BCCI will discuss standard guidelines for such events in its Apex Council meeting on June 14. While RCB faces no punishment, the board aims to prevent future incidents.

title: Who is Kamal Kaur? Popular Punjabi influencer found dead in car
content: Punjab Police are investigating the murder of Instagram influencer Kamal Kaur, whose body was discovered in a locked car near Adesh Medical University in Bathinda. Kaur, known for her explicit content and online controversies, had over 3.83 lakh followers. Police suspect she was killed elsewhere and her body was dumped, exploring potential links to prior threats she received.

title: Middle East: Is Israel ready to hit Iran's nuclear sites? US braces for fallout
content: Tensions escalate as Israel prepares for a potential military operation against Iran. This move could disrupt diplomacy and trigger regional conflict. US intelligence suggests Iran is nearing nuclear weapon capability. Diplomatic talks are stalling. The US is bracing for Israeli action. Retaliatory strikes against US assets are a concern. Oil markets are reacting to the rising tensions.

title: 52-yr-old school rivalry resurfaces; men in 60s assault Class 4 classmate
content: A decades-old schoolyard fight in Kasaragod has reignited after 52 years, leading to a violent confrontation. Balakrishnan, 62, allegedly attacked his former classmate, V J Babu, over a quarrel from their Class IV days. Babu sustained injuries, including lost teeth, after Balakrishnan and another classmate, Mathew, confronted him.

title: KL Rahul has special message to Karun Nair ahead of England series
content: KL Rahul has voiced his support for Karun Nair, who makes a comeback to the Indian Test squad after eight years, citing impressive domestic and county cricket performances. Nair's recent stint with Northampton and a double century for India A highlight his form.

title: Delhi boils: Temperature feels like 52°C; IMD issues 'red' alert for today
content: Delhi is experiencing a severe heatwave. The temperature felt like 51.9 degrees Celsius. The weather department issued a red alert for Thursday. A yellow alert is in place for Friday. Rain and thunderstorms are expected on Friday. Respite from the heat is anticipated from June 13. Moisture-laden winds from the Bay of Bengal and the Arabian Sea will bring relief.

title: Covid-19 without vaccine: How many people would have died? A thought experiment
content: Imagine a world without COVID-19 vaccines: a terrifying reality of endless variants, overwhelmed hospitals, and economies in ruins. Lockdowns persist indefinitely, schools struggle, and mental health declines. Millions more lives would be lost, healthcare systems would collapse, and society would be trapped in a cycle of fear and isolation, highlighting the vital role vaccines played in averting disaster.

title: 'No basis to seek…': US rejects India's WTO consultations on auto tariffs
content: The United States has rebuffed India's request for WTO consultations regarding American tariffs on automobiles and auto components, asserting the tariffs were implemented under a national security provision. The US maintains these measures under the essential security exception within global trade regulations, stating they are not safeguard measures subject to WTO's Agreement on Safeguards.

title: 'What is US really up to?' Jairam Ramesh slams US for inviting Munir
content: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has strongly criticised the United States for inviting Pakistan's army chief General Asim Munir to the US army day celebrations. Ramesh questioned the invitation, citing Munir's inflammatory remarks before the Pahalgam terror attacks. He also objected to US officials describing Pakistan as a counter-terrorism partner.

title: Shubman Gill showcases unique sticker on MRF bat ahead of first Test as captain
content: Shubman Gill's appointment as India's Test captain and his bat sticker featuring "Prince" alongside "MRF Genius" have stirred conversations. This differs from legends like Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli, who endorsed MRF without personal nicknames on their bats. As Gill prepares for the England tour in June 2025, his leadership and MRF association mark a new chapter for Indian cricket.

title: WATCH: Oakland Coliseum readies for cricket with MLC 2025; drop-in pitches installed
content: Major League Cricket's third season makes history as the Oakland Coliseum hosts its first top-level cricket match on the US West Coast. The San Francisco Unicorns will face the Washington Freedom in a rematch of the 2024 final. This event marks a significant step in growing cricket in the United States, with the tournament extending to Texas and Florida.

title: ‘Investors from US interested…’: Adani Airport Holdings may raise $1 bn
content: Adani Airport Holdings is contemplating raising $1 billion from global investors, potentially marking its first external equity funding. Valued at $20 billion, surpassing GMR Airport's market capitalization, AAHL manages seven airports and is set to inaugurate its eighth in Navi Mumbai.

title: Honeymoon murder: Sonam eyed as mastermind; Raj just pawn; hunt on for hideout
content: Investigators now suspect Sonam Raghuvanshi, involved in the honeymoon murder case, might be the mastermind, manipulating Raj Kushwaha with promises of love. Raj may have unknowingly facilitated her escape, as Sonam allegedly planned a hideout in Indore. She remained there while searches were conducted, later fleeing to Uttar Pradesh when the plan unraveled.

title: Kerala ship sinking: 16 days on, police file criminal case; blame crew's mishandling for tragedy
content: Following pressure from fishing communities, police have filed a case against the owner, master, and crew of the MSC Elsa 3, which sank off Alappuzha in May. The FIR cites rash navigation and mishandling of hazardous cargo, leading to environmental damage and economic losses. The sunken vessel released hazardous materials, posing a threat to marine ecosystems and navigation.

title: Elon Musk wealth: Net worth rises, after apology to Donald Trump
content: Elon Musk's net worth increased by $191 million after he expressed regret for his harsh comments about Donald Trump. Musk apologized on X, admitting his posts "went too far." Trump acknowledged Musk's message and expressed his appreciation, according to White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt.

title: Long-range precision weapons make geographical barriers irrelevant: Air Marshal Dixit
content: Air Marshal Ashutosh Dixit highlighted India's Operation Sindoor, showcasing the effectiveness of long-range precision strikes that nullify geographical barriers. He emphasized the importance of real-time situational awareness and deep surveillance in modern conflicts.

title: Project Pelican: Canada busts major drug racket; ISI-backed Khalistan plot suspected
content: Canadian authorities have dismantled a major narco-terror network, dubbed Project Pelican, with alleged ties to Khalistan sympathizers. The operation seized 479 kg of cocaine, valued at $47.9 million, and arrested nine individuals, including seven of Indian origin. Investigations reveal the network used commercial trucking routes from the US, linked to Mexican cartels, to traffic drugs.

title: NEET UG result : Expected announcement date revealed; steps to download scorecards
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) is expected to announce the NEET UG 2025 results soon, following the exam held on May 4. Over 22.7 lakh candidates appeared across 557 cities and 14 foreign centres. Results, along with key performance data and the final answer key, will be available online at neet.nta.nic.in.

title: Who is Dominick McGee? MAGA influencer stirring up outrage on X
content: Dominick McGee, once an obscure online figure, rose to prominence on X through controversial posts, even gaining White House access. He leveraged attention-grabbing tactics, like misgendering Brittney Griner, to boost his visibility. While X's revenue-sharing program initially proved lucrative, earnings became unpredictable.

title: Trump unveils US 'Gold Card' website: Who can apply, eligibility
content: Donald Trump's "Gold Card," offering a path to US citizenship for foreigners investing $5 million, has launched its waiting list. Trump announced the opening via social media, highlighting the immense interest.

title: West Bengal clashes: Police arrests 40 for violence in Maheshtala, says situation ‘under control’
content: 28 persons were arrested by West Bengal police and 12 by Kolkata Police. Seven FIRs have been registered in connection with the violence on Wednesday

title: Legislative Council panel visits Hutti gold mines in Raichur district, suggests improvement in safety measures
content: The visit began with an underground tour of the gold mine, where legislators descended nearly one kilometre to observe the gold extraction process

title: ED arrests ex-Haryana MLA,aide in money laundering case
content: The ED initiated the investigation on the basis of FIR registered at Panchkula by Haryana Police against unknown persons, said the statement.

title: People flock to Raichur to witness spectacular bull power contest at Mungaru Habba
content: Vajrala Tejaswi Reddy’s pair of bulls from Santamagaluru village in Nandyal district of Andhra Pradesh, which managed to drag a 2-tonne boulder an impressive 3,913 feet in 20 minutes, claimed the first prize

title: CBI submits fourth status report in R.G. Kar rape and murder case
content: The parents of the victim have on multiple occasions shared their dissatisfaction with CBI probe and said they are dragging their feet

title: Full arrangements to handle COVID situation, says U.P. government
content: Last month, U.P. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath also conducted review of the health department issuing directions to step up preparedness in case of any spike in cases

title: Singapore-flagged ship fire: Coastal surveillance stepped up amid efforts to recover containers that fell into sea
content: Coastal police and marine enforcement squads are part of patrol off Malabar coast for heightened vigil

title: Two dead, one injured after inhaling poisonous gas at JNPC in Anakapalli
content: The incident took place during the night shift on June 11 when the employees were carrying out procedures to treat waste at the Effluent Treatment Plant  before transferring it to the Common ETP.

title: ED raids in Rajasthan, Gujarat in ₹2,700 cr investors 'fraud' case
content: The case filed under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) stems from a Rajasthan Police FIR against a company called Nexa Evergreen.

title: TS TET hall ticket 2025 released: Step-by-step guide to download hall ticket, dates & other details
content: The TS TET 2025 exam, which will be administered by computer-based test (CBT),  will be held from June 18 to June 30, with two shifts each day. Read more details here

title: Assam will deport 'foreigners' even if their names feature in NRC: Himanta
content: “The way the NRC was carried out in Assam leaves a lot of scope for doubt, and it cannot be the only document for determining a person’s citizenship,” the Chief Minister said.

title: Delhi records highest peak power demand on June 11
content: Amid the red alert red issued for Delhi as it remained in the grip of an intense heatwave, the Capital records peak demand of 8,231 MW on June 11.

title: India suffered three diplomatic setbacks from U.S., foreign policy driven by domestic politics, says Congress
content: Congress general secretary in-charge communications Jairam Ramesh asserted in a post on X that decades of diplomatic progress cannot be allowed to be weakened so easily.

title: Why has the Axiom-4 mission been delayed? | Explained
content: Ahead of the June 11 flight, SpaceX had tested one of the rocket’s engines as a matter of procedure and discovered it was leaking liquid oxygen

title: Singapore-flagged ship fire: Hydrocarbon release detected near fuel tank of burning vessel
content: According to latest situation report released by government agencies,  Salvage Master observations confirmed ongoing hydrocarbon release, with potential involvement of fuel tanks

title: A different approach to the caste census | Explained
content: What have the Bihar caste survey and Telangana’s 2025 caste survey revealed? How is a social management approach different from top-down welfare models? Would a caste census deepen social divide and undermine national unity? What about democratic accountability?

title: Heavy rain lashes parts of Hyderabad on Thursday morning
content: The heaviest rainfall of 14.8 cm was recorded at the University of Hyderabad automatic weather station of Telangana State Development Planning Society

title: U.P. govt suppressed Maha Kumbh death toll, says Rahul Gandhi, cites BBC report
content: BBC report reveals that figures of deaths in Kumbh Mela stampede were hidden. Like in COVID, the bodies of the poor were erased from the statistics. Like after every major railway accident the truth is suppressed, says Rahul Gandhi

title: A chaotic Mangal Eri Park signal near Ambattur Industrial Estate
content: The traffic lights for three of the four roads may by red, but that does not discourage vehicles coming from those three roads from crossing the junction out of turn

title: Raghuvanshi honeymoon murder: ‘Mangalsutra’ left by Sonam at homestay helps investigators crack Meghalaya case
content: The accused persons have admitted to the crime, and with all the evidence, there is no room to deny, says Meghalaya's Director General of Police (DGP) I Nongrang

title: Vance, Rubio played key roles in India-Pak. deescalation: Trump nominee
content: The U.S. and India share a host of common interests, such as ensuring a free and open Indo-Pacific region, which is not dominated by China, expanding bilateral trade

title: Increase in anti-dumping duty by U.S. on Indian shrimp a cause for concern
content: Andhra Pradesh urges Centre to resolve the issues faced by seafood exporters in India by diplomatically engaging with the shrimp importing countries, particularly the U.S.

title: Consider establishing Civil Aviation University in Visakhapatnam: Naidu
content: The design of the terminal building at the Vijayawada airport should be attractive and unique, he tells officials

title: 21 booked for assaulting, stripping three men over witchcraft allegations in Raipur
content: The First Information Report was registered on June 9 following a lower court order on the incident which happened three months ago

title: Krishnam Raju arrested by Thullur police
content: Guntur police confirmed the arrest; police has been searching for Mr Krishnam Raju since his alleged derogatory remarks about Amaravati region and women during a live TV debate

title: ASBL to launch 50-storey residential project in Hyderabad’s financial district
content: Spread across five acres, Broadway will feature three high-rise towers with G+50 floors, comprising a total of 885 three-bedroom apartments; scheduled for completion by December 2029

title: Plea for express trains halt at Malkajgiri station
content: Infrastructure development worth ₹28 crore is under way at Malkajgiri station, according to a memorandum submitted to Union Minister G. Kishan Reddy

title: OBC quota deadlock dominates politics in West Bengal; new list an appeasement move, says BJP
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee says“backwardness”was the only benchmark to decide OBC category. LOP Suvendu Adhikari claimed that new list being prepared by West Bengal government is aimed at “appeasement politics”.

title: Clashes in Bengal leaves several police personnel injured, vehicles vandalised
content: Several police personnel sustained injuries while trying to control the situation. A number of police vehicles were also set on fire by the mob, which was seen pelting stones at the police

title: Government strengthening IT cells to counter terrorist propaganda on social media: Union Home Secretary
content: Police and other investigating agencies are encouraged to “not hesitate to use strict provisions under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act” in all cases where it is necessary, says Govind Mohan

title: Encroachments demolished on key stretches in Pallikonda for drain work
content: The officials said the drive aims to restore the road’s original width of 40 feet, as the current reduced width of 20 feet has led to frequent accidents at night.

title: No scope for third-party intervention, but India, Pakistan should start diplomatic initiatives: CPI(M)
content: CPI(M) leader says military options are limited to deal with terrorism, urges administrative, political, diplomatic initiatives; says restoration of Statehood, Article 370 are key to bringing peace to J&K

title: VCK chief rules out quitting DMK alliance over number of seats in 2026 assembly elections
content: VCK general secretary, D. Ravikumar, said that the DMK should do more to satisfy the demands and expectations of its alliance partners

title: On 11th anniversary, Modi government pitches its work at ‘Amrit generation’ of youth
content: Financial inclusion through Jan Dhan accounts, investments in roads and airports, health insurance, and digital infrastructure projects were listed as among the government’s efforts for the common people, especially the younger generations

title: Residents near Arani hoist black flags against setting up of new Sewage Treatment Plant
content: Panchayat officials said that the proposed plant will be set up on a 1.5-acre plot at the border area of these two villages at a cost of ₹7 crore

title: Airtel cracks down on online fraud in T.N., blocks 1,80,000 malicious links
content: Automatically enabled for all Airtel mobile and broadband customers, the advanced system scans and filters links across SMS, WhatsApp, Telegram, Facebook, Instagram, e-mail, and other browsers

title: Even America cannot control Trump, says Rajyavardhan Rathore
content: The Rajasthan Cabinet Minister was speaking at an event in Bikaner organised to mark 11 years of the BJP government at the Centre

title: Pacers ride Mathurin, bench to Game 3 victory
content: Bennedict Mathurin scored 27 points, leading a Pacers unit that enjoyed a whopping 49-18 edge in bench points, and Indiana reclaimed the lead in the NBA Finals by beating Oklahoma City 116-107 in Game 3 on Wednesday night.

title: OKC points to 'unforced errors' amid unraveling
content: The Thunder were outscored 32-18 in the fourth quarter Wednesday night as they lost to the Pacers in Game 3 of the NBA Finals.

title: Wilson exits with head injury as Aces fall to Sparks
content: Aces star A'ja Wilson will be reevaluated Thursday after departing in the third quarter of Wednesday's 94-84 loss to the Sparks with what the team said was a head injury.

title: Run-heavy Steelers aim for balance with Rodgers
content: Steelers offensive coordinator Arthur Smith said he hopes last year's run-heavy offense can transition into more of a run-pass balance under new quarterback Aaron Rodgers.

title: Bueckers hot in return, explodes for 35 in loss
content: Back after missing four games, Paige Bueckers made her first six shots and finished with 35 points Wednesday night in a 93-80 loss to the Mercury.

title: Dobbins defends claim father played for Yankees
content: Red Sox rookie Hunter Dobbins said there is nothing nefarious about the connections he said his father had to the Yankees despite a report saying the claims were nefarious.

title: Twins' Buxton exults in 479-foot 'big boy' homer
content: The Twins' Byron Buxton put on a "mesmerizing" display Wednesday night, laucnhing the second-longest homer in the majors this season and making a diving catch in center field.

title: 🤝 Five Kevin Durant trade proposals
content: With the Suns and Durant meeting to sift through trade destinations, our NBA insiders break down five deals that work -- and pick a winner in the potential KD sweepstakes.

title: U.S. Open storylines: Scheffler's dominance, DeChambeau's chances and how hard Oakmont will play
content: Is it Scottie Scheffler vs. the field this week? Could Oakmont produce an over-par winner? We look at five storylines to watch this week.

content: The majority of NFL mandatory minicamps are in action this week. Our reporters have the latest from around the league.

content: Howell is a high school junior from Georgia who shot 63-63 in qualifying to get into the field. How did he get here, and what is he hoping for from the biggest week of his golfing career.

content: Best player available? Fill a need? We played out both strategies for 30 first-round slots in the draft.

content: One shift in Game 3 encapsulated everything that the veteran center can do on the ice. Here's how he got here.

content: The annual event took place this past week in Buffalo -- with major repercussions for the draft on June 27-28.

content: It's Messi and Ronaldo's last dance, and new stars will be born. Just how far can the U.S. go? The big talking points 12 months out from the World Cup.

content: The congested stretch from Boston to Washington is already beleaguered by breakdowns and spotty service.

title: Tuchel: My mom finds Bellingham rage 'repulsive'
content: England manager Thomas Tuchel has said he understands criticism of Jude Bellingham after the midfielder's emotions boiled over during the shock defeat to Senegal on Tuesday.

title: Sporting demand more than $80M for Gyökeres
content: Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyökeres will not be available for €70 million ($80m) this summer, the club's president has warned amid interest from Manchester United.

title: Miami owner 'fully expects' MLS calendar shift
content: Inter Miami co-owner Jorge Mas said he expects MLS will soon agree to align with the international soccer calendar.

title: Gold Cup monitoring L.A. protests before opener
content: Concacaf said on Wednesday it was in "close and ongoing communication" with local officials as protests in Los Angeles continue ahead of the Gold Cup's opening match at SoFi Stadium.

title: Grealish left out of Man City Club World Cup squad
content: Jack Grealish has been left out of Manchester City's 28-man squad for the Club World Cup, the Premier League side confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Sources: Coffey has Thorns extension through '27
content: USWNT midfielder Sam Coffey signed a contract extension with the Portland Thorns last year to tie her to the NWSL club through the 2027 season, sources told ESPN.

title: Inter Miami's key to Club World Cup success? Rest Messi in MLS
content: Lionel Messi is perhaps the greatest soccer player of all time, but his MLS team Inter Miami tends to reserve him for the bigger games and competitions -- like this summer's Club World Cup.

title: Wetzel: It's new rules, same old game in NCAA athlete pay
content: College athletics is back in the rules business now that schools can directly pay players, Dan Wetzel writes.

title: Air India Changes Profile Picture After Flight With 242 On Board Crashes
content: Air India changed its social media profile picture soon after its London bound flight crashed in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. Across its social media platforms, Air India replaced its profile picture to a black circle, a change from the logo.

title: Air India Ahmedabad-London Plane Crash: What We Know So Far
content: An Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner from Ahmedabad to London's Gatwick Airport crashed shortly after takeoff this afternoon. Flight AI171, with 242 on board, went down minutes after departing from the airport.

title: Ahmedabad Plane Crash Live Updates: Air India Plane Crashed On Students' Hostel, Amit Shah Heading To Ahmedabad
content: Gujarat Plane Crash Live Updates: A plane crashed near Ahmedabad airport on Thursday afternoon, officials said. Rescue operations are underway.

title: Plane May Not Have Achieved Optimum Take-Off Speed Due To Bird Hit: Experts
content: A bird hit may have prevented the Air India flight, which crashed near Ahmedabad airport, from achieving the optimum speed for take-off, leading to the crash, experts have told NDTV.

title: Horrific Visuals From Air India Plane Crash Site As Details Emerge
content: An Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner carrying 242 passengers crashed shortly after taking off from Ahmedabad airport.

title: How Tech Could Help Manage Anxiety - The Most Common Mental Health Problem
content: Anxiety disorders are the worlds most common mental health problem. But it isnt always easy to get professional help, with long waiting lists in many countries.

title: "Shocked, Devastated": Aviation Minister On Ahmedabad Air India Plane Crash
content: Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu expressed shock over the Air India flight crash with 242 on board in Ahmedabad this afternoon and said he has activated all emergency response teams.

title: Air India Crash: Pilots Sent "Mayday Call", Then Silence
content: A "Mayday" distress call was issued by Air India's AI 171 flight, minutes before it crashed after taking off from Gujarat's Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport on Thursday.

title: Catastrophic Failure To Gain Lift: What Experts Said On Air India Dreamliner Crash - 5 Points
content: An Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crashed immediately after taking off from Ahmedabad airport today. Analysing the visuals, while it is too early to find a cause, experts say there seems to be a loss of thrust or lift, or it could be a bird hit.

content: An Air India flight crashed minutes after taking off from Gujarat's Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport in Ahmedabad on Thursday.

title: Ahmedabad Airport Shut For Operations Temporarily After Air India Crash

title: Air India Flight To London Crashes Moments After Take-Off In Ahmedabad
content: An Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner carrying 242 people crashed immediately after taking off from Ahmedabad airport. The flight was going to London. There were 232 passengers and 10 crew, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said.

title: RFK Jr.s New Vaccine Panel Includes Self-Proclaimed Anti-Vaxxer
